hints.content: So, for $( \blueD{6}, \greenD{4})$, our $\blueD{x\text{-coordinate}}$ is $\blueD{6}$, and our $\greenD{y\text{-coordinate}}$ is $\greenD{4}$.

options.alt: A coordinate grid. The x-axis is labeled 1 to 9. The y-axis is labeled 1 to 9. A blue arrow moves right along the x-axis from the unlabeled 0 to the 3.

hints.content:
Now we go up to $\greenD{4}$ on the $y$-axis, and plot the point $(\blueD{3}, \greenD{4})$:



[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A coordinate grid. The x-axis is labeled 1 to 9. The y-axis is labeled 1 to 9. A blue arrow moves right along the x-axis from the unlabeled 0 to the 3. A green arrow moves up 4 squares from the 3 on the x-axis to align with 4 on the y-axis. A point labeled (3, 4) is plotted.

hints.content:
Here is $(3,4)$ plotted on the coordinate plane.



[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A coordinate grid shows the ordered pair (3,4) as a plot point.
